dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. NEW YORK CITY STREET - DAY Lee is walking down the street, looking around her.  The sidewalk is fairly crowded with people; the sounds of traffic are heard.  She passes some office buildings, a store's large display window; she stops when she sees Hannah. Her sister is waiting outside the Art Deco facade of a restaurant; she's looking in the opposite direction.  Lee taps Hannah on the shoulder; Hannah, surprised, turns and gasps.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : Summer in New York. A piano plays "Bewitched" in the background as the film cuts to a large tree, covered with bright white blossoms.  The camera moves down the tree to reveal a well-kept, red-brick brownstone on a pleasant, sunny New York City street.  A man wearing a summer suit walks by as the film moves inside the building, to Elliot's analyst's office.  The psychotherapist sits in a comfortable armchair next to a curtained window. In front of the window sits a table covered with artifacts and a large lamp.  The analyst's fingers are touching, his arms resting on the chair, as he listens to the offscreen Elliot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: can't seem to take action. I'm-I'm like, uh, Hamlet unable to kill his uncle. The music stops as the camera moves across the room to reveal Elliot, sitting in a wooden chair.  He holds a long, thin cigarette; he wears a gold Rolex watch.  He face is not yet seen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (face offscreen) I want Lee, but I can't harm Hannah. And in no other area am I a procrastinator. Elliot raises his cigarette to take a drag.  The camera follows the cigarette up to his face.  Elliot looks thoughtful as the movie cuts to: EXT. COLUMBIA UNIVERSITY CAMPUS - DAY Lee, wearing jeans and carrying an armful of books, is running up a broad set of steps in the sunlight, greeting other students as she passes.  Elliot continues to talk over the scene...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meanwhile...Lee has no direction. She's taking courses at Columbia...but just randomly. ...as Lee stops on a portico and turns to greet Doug, a professor, who is running over to her, calling her name. They mouth hello, smiling, and begin to walk off together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I try not to call her, but then she calls me and then...I call and...we try to resist meeting, but...once in a while we meet.  Sometimes we argue because I can't break up my marriage.  Sometimes we wind up making love and...we both feel terrible. The film cuts back to Elliot in his analyst's office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But it's my fault. Elliot takes a last drag on his cigarette.  The camera follows his hand as he crushes it out in a nearby ashtray.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (face offscreen) For all my education, accomplishments, and so-called wisdom...I can't fathom my own heart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What makes you interested in becoming a Hare Krishna?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (gesturing, walking onscreen) Well, I'm not saying that I want to join or anything, but...but I know you guys believe in reincarnation, you know, so it interests me.

direction.raw_text: Yeah, well, what's your religion?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (gesturing) Well, I was born Jewish, you know, but, uh, but last winter I tried to become a Catholic and...it didn't work for me.  I-I studied and I tried and I gave it everything, but, you know, Catholicism for me was die now, pay later, you know. And I just couldn't get with it. And I, and I wanted to, you know.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. CENTRAL PARK - DAY Hare Krishna music is heard over a sunlit view of the Manhattan skyline and the green trees of Central Park.  The camera moves down to reveal a large group of Hare Krishnas dancing on the broad green lawn among other New Yorkers enjoying the day.  The leader, holding some pamphlets, stands by a chain-link fence, a few feet away from his group, talking to someone on the other side.  It's Mickey, as the camera soon shows, wearing a short-sleeved shirt, a paper tucked under his arm.

direction.raw_text: (interrupting) You're afraid of dying?

direction.raw_text: (gesturing) Well...yeah, naturally.  Aren't you?

direction.raw_text: (nodding, taking the material) Uh-huh.

direction.raw_text: ...read it over, and think about it.

direction.raw_text: (looking down at the material he's just received) Well, okay.  Thank you very much.

direction.raw_text: You're welcome.  Hare Krishna. Mickey walks off, the Hare Krishnas still dancing and singing on the other side of the fence.  He flips through the literature as he walks, then looks straight ahead, pondering.  His voice is heard over the screen.

direction.raw_text: Who are you kidding?  You're gonna be a Krishna?  You're gonna shave your head and put on robes and dance around at airports?  You'll look like Jerry Lewis.  Oh, God, I'm so depressed. Mickey puts his hand to his mouth as another title appears on a black screen. Autumn chill. Bach's Concerto for Harpsichord is heard as the film cuts to the waterfront at dusk.  A bench faces some wharf pilings; the water gently laps against them as Lee walks into view, the wind blowing her hair.  She stands and faces the water and the distant skyline across the bay.  The view is contemplative, beautiful in the dim light. Lee is alone; her hands are in her pockets.  Lee, thinking, is heard over the scene; the harpsichord music plays in the background.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The nights are really getting cooler.  Summer went so quickly. Soon it'll be fall. (walking to the beach and sitting down) My literature professor really likes me.  It was fun being out with him last night. (staring pensively at the water) Funny.  I feel like I'm betraying Elliot...but that's ridiculous. Why shouldn't I see Doug?  Elliot's not free. (pausing) Just go one step at a time.  Let's see what the next few months bring. The concerto stops and the movie cuts to Holly, leaning into an open phone booth near a subway entrance.  She wears a football jacket, jeans, and sneakers; she holds a manuscript in her arms.  It's a busy corner.  People rush past Holly towards the subway; others are walking up the station steps. Holly smokes a cigarette as she talks on the phone to Hannah.

direction.raw_text: (into the telephone) Hannah?  Hi.  Listen, um, you'll be happy to know that your money has not gone completely to waste... No, I have an actual first rough draft of something I wrote... Yeah.  Yeah. Yeah, well, I showed it to Lee, and she gave me some good pointers. And, um, listen, I'm pretty near where you live.  I wonder if I could just drop it off...and, you know, when you have time, some time, read it, an-and we'll talk when I come over at Thanksgiving. Okay?  All right.  Okay.  Oh, wait, wait. (turning her body, still on the phone) Listen.  Listen.  I think Lee met an interesting guy at Columbia... Yeah.  Yeah, well, he sounds really nice... (puffing on her cigarette) Yeah.  Okay.  All right.  Well, we'll talk at Thanksgiving.  Bye-bye. Holly hangs up the phone and takes a drag on her cigarette. She looks off in the distance, smiling, as the film cuts to: INT. HANNAH'S APARTMENT - THANKSGIVING - NIGHT It's Thanksgiving at Hannah's once again.  Guests are crowded together in the living room, surrounding the piano, where Evan is sitting and flipping through some sheet music. Norma stands behind him, leaning against a book-laden wall. The guests are chattering, enjoying themselves; a lamp glows on the corner of the piano.  A little boy sitting in a chair next to Evan is talking animatedly with a girl who is leaning over the arm of the sofa.  An adult guest talks to the little boy; another guest takes a sip of wine from a glass she'd placed on the bookshelf behind her as Evan turns and addresses the group.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (gesturing) Now, here...here's a song that Norma sang on that trip we made up to the show in Buffalo.  And, oh, was she beautiful that night! The guests laugh appreciatively.  A woman comes over to Evan and hands him some wine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on. (laughing and touching Evan's shoulder)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (overlapping, to the woman) Thank you, honey. (putting his drink down on the piano) Oh, yes, you were, dear.  Don't you remember that night? (gesturing and pushing back some sheet music that was starting to fall) She was so beautiful...she was so beautiful that when men saw her walking along the streets, they'd drive their cars right up on the sidewalk. He laughs; the guests laugh with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (looking back at Norma) Isn't that right, honey, eh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (tapping his shoulder) A slight exaggeration. The guest continue to laugh; they are charmed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (overlapping Norma, laughing) I know.

direction.raw_text: (gesturing) But only slight. Evan continues to laugh with everyone as he starts to play the piano.  A nearby woman toasts him with her drink.  The camera moves around the room as he plays, showing the various guests, chattering over the music.  Some are in clusters, in private conversations; others listen and watch the offscreen Evan.  A couple stands by the window; one man gets up from his chair and walks away.  Some guests sip their drinks, smiling, as the camera moves back to the piano and the book-laden wall.  Evan is playing the piano with exuberance.  Norma, still standing behind him, has a poignant, wistful expression on her face.  She mouths the words to the song Evan is playing, "It Could Happen to You." The woman next to her smiles, enjoying the music, as the camera continues its exploration, moving to a man standing in the doorway with a group of children.  Mavis the maid walks by with a tray of hors d'oeuvres.  The man takes one, mouthing his thanks, as the camera travels past the open bookshelf, past two boys in suits who are drinking soda and munching, to reveal Lee.  She is leaning against another doorway, a faraway look on her face as she listens to the music.  Mavis passes in the hall beyond the doorway.  Several people, deep in conversation, stand nearby as Elliot, holding a drink, walks up behind her.

direction.raw_text: (sipping his drink) You've been very cold to me tonight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (glancing back at Elliot, then turning away) No.

direction.raw_text: Is something wrong?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (turning) Oh, not here. (touching Elliot's arm) There are too many people around. Lee slips past Elliot and walks away.  Elliot looks back at her briefly, then, sipping his drink, he turns and looks offscreen at the crowd in the living room.

direction.raw_text: (looking offscreen) Hey, Hannah?  You know, I think Lee is really serious about her new boyfriend.  Yeah, eh, from what I understand he sounds really nice. Hannah walks into view, headed for the refrigerator.  She carries two tomatoes.

direction.raw_text: I'm so happy for her.  I think she's in love. Hannah opens the refrigerator, totally ignoring Holly.

direction.raw_text: (reacting) Hey, what's the matter?

direction.raw_text: (taking a bunch of celery out and slamming the refrigerator door) I'm real upset about what you wrote. Hannah walks over to the table, gathering up more food.

direction.raw_text: My script?

direction.raw_text: It's obviously based on Elliot and me.

direction.raw_text: Oh, so loosely.

direction.raw_text: (angrily) No, not "Oh, so loosely"!  Real specifically!  Is that how you see us?

direction.raw_text: (shrugging, walking out of the pantry area) Well--

direction.raw_text: (interrupting) Can I, can I not accept gestures and feelings from people?  Do I, do I put people off? Holly walks over to the sink and washes her hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (reacting) Well, it's a made-up story. She dries her hands as Hannah, her arms laden with vegetables, strides over to her sister.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (yelling) No, it's real exact!  The-the situations, the dialogue, everything. It's-it's full of intimate details between Elliot and me! Which I don't, I don't see how you could even possibly know about.  A conversation we once had about adoption? Hannah storms out a nearby door as Holly turns away from the sink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (gesturing, the towel still in her hand, as she speaks to her offscreen sister) Well, Lee mentioned that to me, so obviously you discussed it with her. You... (pacing around the table) I just took the essence and I blew it up into drama. Holly wipes her hand on the towel as Hannah reenters the kitchen, carrying even more vegetables.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't see how Lee could know about these things.  I don't!  I don't tell her everything. Hannah strides into the pantry area and flops the vegetables down on the counter.  Holly puts the dishtowel down and absently straightens some things on the food-laden table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (reacting) Wow, I guess I hit a nerve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (turning to look at Holly) You make it sound like, you know, I have no needs or something.  You think I'm too self-sufficient?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (stopping her mindless straightening at the table, reacting) Now, Hannah, that's not what I meant, you know. (walking offscreen to the sink area) Uh, yeah, everybody relies on you for so much. "You're so giving. It's not a criticism.  We love you. We're grateful."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (walking out of the pantry to the food- laden table) You're grateful, but you resent me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (offscreen) Oh, wow!  I don't want to have this conversation.  I didn't do anything wrong. Hannah angrily gathers up some spices from the table; Holly walks back onscreen holding a silver ice bucket.  She stops at the corner of the table and faces Hannah.

direction.raw_text: (onscreen) Y-you mentioned to me yourself that you and Elliot were having some problems.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (gesturing) Yeah, we're having some problems, but problems that are my business...which I don't see how you could know about in such detail. How does Lee know about these things?  How?  They're private! Hannah picks up a large bowl and carries it, as well as her armload of spices, into the pantry area.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (turning to look at her sister as she walks past) Well, why don't you share them with us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (with her back to the camera) I don't...I don't want to bother everyone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (facing her sister's back) That's the point.  I'd like to be bothered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (turning to look at Holly) I don't see how you could know about these things unless Elliot's been talking to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shaking her head) No, he hasn't.  If I offended you, I'm sorry. Hannah, reacting, puts the spices down on the pantry counter. Holly turns away. The film cuts to the dining room doorway.  Guests can be seen mingling and talking and helping themselves at a buffet table in the living room.  Lee and Elliot can be heard offscreen as the camera slowly moves from the doorway across the empty dining room to reveal them in the midst of an intense conversation.  The piano, as well as soft chatter, is heard in the background.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (offscreen) It's over, Elliot.  I don't know how to make it any clearer.  It's over.  I can't see you anymore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (offscreen, overlapping) Uh... (onscreen, gesturing)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. HANNAH'S KITCHEN - NIGHT Holly is standing in the pantry, preparing some offscreen food.  Near her is a restaurantlike swinging door with a glass porthole.  In the foreground, the kitchen table is crowded with bowls and plates of food.  An open cupboard separates Holly from the rest of the room.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: know.  I deserve this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (touching her chest) Look, I'm just as much at fault.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (overlapping, gesturing) If-if-if you can believe I have such feelings for you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got to be honest with you.  I met someone else.  I've met someone else. (turning and walking away from Elliot) I...I told you I wasn't going to wait forever. Lee goes over to an open door and closes it quickly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (offscreen) But it hasn't been forever. (walking over to Lee at the just-closed door)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (gesturing) It's been nearly a year since our first time and you're still married to my sister, which...I now realize is fine because you're probably much more in love with her than you know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shaking his head) Yeah, but we-we made so many plans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (overlapping, gesturing) Yeah.  Uh, well, sure we did.  An- an-and in a way you led me on, because I truly believed you were unhappy with Hannah.  Otherwise, I would never have let myself be drawn in.  I was very weak.  So were you.  Now I've met someone else. The door opens and Mavis appears, holding a set of candlesticks.  She walks over to the dining room table, which is already decked out with a floral centerpiece, glassware, and china.  She puts them down as Lee and Elliot stand awkwardly near the door, waiting for her to leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Mavis) Dinner soon?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: About fifteen minutes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (nodding) Uh-huh.  Good. Mavis leaves.  Both Lee and Elliot quickly close the door behind her and immediately pick up where they'd left off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you're in love overnight?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I care a great deal about him, yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (trying to put his arm around Lee) Lee...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pulling back, flinging her hands) Ah, it's over!  Elliot, I mean it. It's over! They look at each other, reacting, as the film cuts back to Hannah's kitchen.  Norma's face can be seen in the porthole window on the other side of the pantry's swinging door.  She looks around the kitchen, then opens the door and steps inside.  Holly stands nearby, working in the pantry area.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (holding the door, half in and half out of the kitchen) Sweetheart, I loved your script.  I thought it was so clever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (turning to Norma, smiling, and holding a glass of wine) Well, you're my mother.  Not everybody's gonna be such a sucker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (gesturing) I particularly liked the character of the mother.  Just a boozy old flirt with a filthy mouth. Holly chuckles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm so proud!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Mom, thanks. Norma steps back out of the kitchen, the door swinging shut behind her.  Holly looks at the door, sipping her wine, as the movie cuts back to Hannah's living room.  A chubby, friendly uncle sits on a sofa, one child on his lap and several others gathered cross-legged around him on the floor. They lean on the coffee table, which is covered with glasses and a bowl of chips.  Other guests mingle in the background; one couple enters the living room, smiling at the scene on the sofa.  Mavis crosses the well-lit foyer in the background and opens the door to more guests.  The piano plays on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (raising his bottle of beer to the children) Now here's a toast to Thanksgiving, all right? The children mutter their enthusiastic agreement, picking up their "illicit" glasses of beer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are we supposed to have beer? Yeeeah! The uncle pours more beer from his bottle into the kids' outstretched glasses.  They cry indistinctly with excitement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (overlapping the children's squeals of delight) Let me at it! (to one of the little boys) How's that, Fletcher? Laughing, he turns to the little girl sitting on his lap; he clinks his bottle against the bottle she is holding, which is almost as big as she is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to the little girl) Doll?  To Thanksgiving.  Here's a little toast, doll. (clinking glasses) Come on.  Bottoms up. The uncle and the children happily drink their beer as the movie cuts to a wall with subtly patterned wallpaper in Hannah's bedroom.  Her face moves on to the screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to the offscreen Elliot) Have you been talking to Holly or Lee about us?  About our-our personal life?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (offscreen) Me?  Of course not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's things Holly wrote about in her script about us that are so...personal they could only have come from you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (offscreen) Look, I've got a splitting headache and I don't like being accused. Hannah walks towards Elliot; he's in the bathroom standing over the sink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (gesturing) I'm not accusing.  I'm asking.  Do you...do you find me too...too giving? (closing the door of the bathroom slightly so only she is seen on the screen) Too-too-too competent?  Too-too, I don't know, disgustingly perfect or something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Elliot walks from behind the partially closed door to an offscreen medicine cabinet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (following Elliot and gesturing, talking to his back) Well, what is it then?  What?  Eh, what's come between us?  How have I alienated you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (taking a bottle of aspirin from the cabinet and walking back to the sink, gesturing) Hannah, my head is throbbing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (gesturing) You never want to talk about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Every time I bring it up, you- you change the subject.  What is it? Do you-- We're communicating less and less.  You sleep with me less and less.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (angrily turning to Hannah and pointing as she shouts) Hannah, I am very mixed up!  Now please! Elliot turns back to the sink, once again obscured by the partially closed door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (reacting, her voice trembling slightly, and gesturing) Do you talk to Holly or Lee behind my back?  Do you?  You must.  They- they seem to know so much about us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (walking towards a towel rack and gesturing) Well, maybe I've asked advice once or twice or-or made a joke. He dries his hands as Hannah, standing behind him, continues to talk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (gesturing) Well, what do you do?  Do-do-do you talk to Holly, or Lee, or what?  Do you, do you, do you phone them?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (whirling around to face Hannah, snapping) Leave me alone, can you?! He closes the door, briefly obscuring Hannah and himself from view.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (continuing in a lower tone) Jesus, I've told you.  I need someone I can matter to. The camera moves behind the closed door, into the bathroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (reacting, near tears) You matter to me.  Completely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pausing, his voice rising again) It's hard to be around someone who gives so much and-and needs so little in return! He opens the medicine cabinet and puts the aspirin bottle back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (gesturing, pleading) But, look...I-I have enormous needs. Elliot slams the medicine cabinet shut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shouting) Well, I can't see them, and neither can Lee or Holly! He leaves.  Hannah watches him go, reacting.  She is stunned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (offscreen) It's so pitch-black tonight.  I feel lost.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (offscreen) You're not lost. Elliot turns the lamp back on, then turns to Hannah; she is lying on her side of the bed, partially in shadow.  He leans over and kisses her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love you so much. They begin to kiss passionately as "Bewitched" starts to play in the background.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (gesturing) Mmm, I don't know if you remember me, but we had the worst night of my life together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (laughing, holding some records) I remember you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (overlapping) Yes, you do recall, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (overlapping, smiling and nodding) I recall you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (gesturing) I was walking past and I saw you in here...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (overlapping, nodding) Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...and I thought I'd come in and...and we could replay, uh, the whole, uh...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (interrupting, laughing and shaking her head) We didn't hit it off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (overlapping, smiling) Oh, that's putting it mildly.  We did everything but exchange gunshots.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good.  How are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (overlapping) You look wonderful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (chuckling, shaking her head) Oh, no.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (overlapping, scratching his head) Yeah, really.  You do.  You do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was a terrible evening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, it was.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (overlapping, gesturing) Remember slamming the cab door in my face and.. (touching his nose as Holly laughs) you know, it came very dangerously close to emasculating my nose in a... (touching his nose again)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (overlapping, laughing) I'd never do that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (continuing) ...in a really horrible way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiling, glancing away for a moment) Oh, well, that was a long time ago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (overlapping) You look wonderful.  You do.  What happened to you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shrugging) People change...you know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (touching Holly's shoulder) Well, I hope you've changed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I hope you have, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (overlapping) I hope so for your sake, because, uh, your personality left something to be desired...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (overlapping, shaking her head) Yeah, and for yours.  I'm sure you've changed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (continuing) ...namely a personality. Holly chuckles and turns to look at more records.  She walks down the aisle, occasionally glancing at the bins of records. Mickey walks beside her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So how are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiling) I'm okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You didn't answer my question. What are you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, nothing much.  You know...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (interrupting) Well...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (overlapping) ...just some stuff.  A little of this, a little of that, that's all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (overlapping) Yeah?  Is that an embarrassing question?  Should I have not asked it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (laughing) Probably not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you, are you out of work or something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, well...I've been trying to write.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (picking up a record and looking at it) Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, that's interesting.  Wh-what kind of stuff?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (touching her chin for a moment) Oh...well, you-you're not interested in this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (overlapping) No, you can tell me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I am.  I am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (overlapping) Oh, no, millions of people come up to you and say, "Hey, I have something I just wrote," right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody ever said it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (overlapping) This is it.  Yeah.  This is really--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (interrupting, turning from the record bins to look at Mickey) Well, wo-would you be willing to-to read it?  Something...that I wrote?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (nodding his head) Well, yes, I would if, uh, if it would mean anything to you.  I don't know why it would.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (laughing, touching her face) No, the reason I ask is--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (overlapping) You've always hated my taste in the past.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pulling her jacket off her shoulders) No, I haven't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (gesturing, looking at Mickey) I haven't.  No, the reason why I ask is I think it might make a great, uh, television script, and, you know, you're so active in television, so--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (chuckling, gesturing) I'm not anymore.  I haven't, I haven't been in television for a year.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're kidding me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (overlapping) I've done no television whatsoever. No. As Mickey continues to speak, Holly walks to another bin of records, reacting to his words.  She looks offscreen at him, then down at some records.  The camera follows her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (offscreen, continuing) I may, I may have to get back into it, 'cause my accountant says that I'm running out of dollars. But...but, um, no, I haven't, I just sort of dropped out for a year...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (overlapping, nodding) Oh.  Oh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (offscreen, overlapping) ...which is a long, dull story and I won't get into it.  But-- Mickey walks back onscreen to Holly.  The two of them are partially obscured by a large white Jazz sign imprinted with a large red circle as they continue their conversation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (interrupting) You're okay, though, huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm-- Yes.  Yes, I'm fine.  I'm fine.  How are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (face offscreen, obscured by the sign) Oh, I'm fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What...what about your script? (face offscreen obscured by the sign) So what's it about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (face offscreen) Well, I'd love it if you'd read it, actually, 'cause I really would value your opinion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (face offscreen) You have to remember, we-we-we didn't agree on one thing. They emerge from behind the Jazz sign, still walking, still talking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiling, gesturing) But you have to remember while you're reading and you're cursing my name, you know, that this is my first script.  Well, it's not my first script.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hmm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (touching her face) Actually, my first script was about Hannah and her husband, but, uh...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Hannah read it, she got really angry, and... you know, then I felt badly, so I-- She picks up a record.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (overlapping) Oh, well, God, I can imagine what you wrote.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, no!  It wasn't anything bad. But she just... you know.  I don't know. Mickey pulls out a record and looks at it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, uh...I threw it out, but I have this other one. Holly looks hopefully at Mickey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, you know, I-I-I...you know, if you want me to, I'll read it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (overlapping, gesturing) Oh, gosh, I don't know. (pausing) Well, could I come over tomorrow and read it to you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (chuckling) Come over tomorrow and read it to me? Holly laughs, embarrassed, as Mickey puts the record he's been looking at back in the bin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You must be joking.  I've been doing all my own reading since I was forty...you know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (laughing, looking at Mickey) Hmm.  I think it's lucky I ran into you. (laughing) Maybe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (laughing) Well, what about me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (chuckling, waving her arm) Oh, well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (overlapping, gesturing) I should have kept going.  I-I have a sneaking feeling, a nagging sensation I should've kept walking and... Holly chuckles, looking off for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (continuing, looking at Holly) ...and not begun this conversation. There is a brief pause and the movie cuts to: INT. MICKEY'S APARTMENT - DAY The screen shows a chaise in Mickey's apartment; an ashtray on a stand sits nearby.  The camera moves down the chaise, past several piles of books, to Mickey's coffee table.  He sits, picking at his fingers and listening, on the edge of the table in front of Holly, who is sitting cross-legged on the floor, propped up with a pillow, reading her script aloud.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (offscreen, as the camera moves across the room towards her and Mickey, reading) "We all go through life playing the hand we're dealt.  Craig: And what hand were you dealt? (onscreen now) "Emily: I'm two high pair, maybe even aces up.  The problem is, you've got three deuces." Holly closes the script and looks up at Mickey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's the end. Mickey smiles and shrugs, not knowing what to say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, you can tell me straight.  It's okay.  Just, you know, tell me what you think.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shaking his head, shrugging) It's great.  I swea-- I'm-- I'm, tch, I'm speechless.  I was...I was not in the mood to listen to this thing now. (sighing) I don't know what to say.  I'm moved and I laughed and I-- Uh, I, you know, I was on the edge of my seat.  I just think it's wonderful! I'm, I'm totally...stunned.  This is not an insult.  I'm amazed that you can... (sighing) It was-- I just thought it was great.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (reacting) Really?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (grunting and gesturing) Yes!  I was abso-- And...w- what...made you think of that climax scene where the, where the... architect is walking home with his actress girlfriend and-and the ex- wife who's schizophrenic jumps out of the bushes and stabs him to death?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (laughing and nodding) Oh, it just came to me one day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (gesturing) Well, it was just fabulous!  I'm,
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. HANNAH'S LIVING ROOM - ANOTHER NIGHT The dark hallway is illuminated by light coming from the offscreen foyer; pictures line the wall.  Piano music is still heard very softly in the background as Hannah, hugging herself, walks slowly down the hallway into the living room. She briefly looks around, lost in thought.  She sits down heavily, tiredly, on the arm of the couch as the movie cuts to several framed photographs on the mantel.  One shows Hannah and Elliot on their wedding day.  Another shows Elliot, obscured in the shadows.  Yet another has captured Norma as a young girl.  The camera, however, moves closer and closer to a photograph showing Hannah, Lee, and Holly, the three sisters, smiling into the camera.  There is no sound.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. HANNAH'S BEDROOM - NIGHT The film shows the bedroom night table, holding a small lamp, a wooden box, a cast-iron fire truck, an ashtray, and glasses.  Elliot's pajama-clad arm moves into view.  He turns off the lamp; the room is now pitch-black.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : Lucky I ran into you. "Bewitched" continues as the film cuts to a busy nighttime New York City street.  Mickey, his hands in his pockets, walks along the sidewalk, one person among many other pedestrians.  He pulls his coat tighter around him as he walks. "Bewitched" continues to play as he passes Tower Records' neon-lit window.  He glances inside...and sees Holly, her jacket flung over her shoulders, looking at some records. Mickey walks through the revolving doors of Tower Records, up a few stairs to the selling floor proper, and stops right in front of Holly.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: you know...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (gasping, hitting her forehead with her hand) Oh, gosh, you really think I can write?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (gesturing) I thought it was wonder-- There's maybe one or two things in there that I would do differently myself, but...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (gasping and nodding) Right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (continuing) ...but who cares?  It was just-- (gesturing) It was fabulous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (chuckling) Oh!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiling and shaking his head) Fabulous, I mean it!  I'm so impressed. Holly, thrilled with Mickey's overwhelming response, stands up, her hand on her head. Unable to contain herself, she begins to walk up and down the room, holding her script.  The camera follows her; Mickey is now offscreen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (laughing) Oh, God!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (offscreen, overlapping) I am.  You-you made my day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (gasping) Oh, wow!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (offscreen) It was just great.  Uh, I was all set...I was set to be bored stiff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (grinning, looking at the offscreen Mickey) Uh, gee.  Would you like to have lunch?  Uh, uh...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (offscreen)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: would love to talk to you about, uh, that script.  I-I, you know, I think maybe that we could do something with it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (nodding) Okay, and listen, I would like to hear what made you suddenly decide to drop out of life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (offscreen) Oh, who cares?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (gesturing) Y-you used to-- Oh, no!  Yeah, I care.  You used to be so ambitious and... (pausing, grinning) God, you really liked it?! "You Made Me Love You" starts to play as the movie cuts to the street outside Mickey's apartment house, an old building complete with a red entrance door and a gray, weather-beaten facade.  Trees line the sidewalk.  Holly and Mickey emerge from the door and walk up the street, revealing a whole row of similar apartment buildings.  They pass a few other people as they walk. The film then moves to the outside of a charming glass and stainedwood cafe.  Through the window, Holly and Mickey can be seen having lunch.  Holly is talking animatedly; Mickey takes a sip of coffee.  Some people pass by. Next, the film cuts to an almost isolated path in Central Park, complete, with old-fashioned streetlamps and scattered leaves.  Holly and Mickey stroll into view, deep in conversation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (gesturing) Gosh, you really went through a crisis, you know that?  H-how did you get over it?  I mean, when I ran into you, you seemed, you seemed just perfectly fine.  Well, you seem fine now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well... (chuckling) I'll tell you. (sighing) One day about a month ago... The film abruptly cuts to Mickey's flashback, a visual counterpoint to the story he is telling Holly.  A close-up of a nervous, perspiring, and panting Mickey alone in his apartment appears on the screen as his voice is heard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...I really hit bottom.  You know, I just felt that in a Godless universe, I didn't want to go on living.  Now I happen to own this rifle... (coughing) Mickey raises the barrel of a rifle to his forehead.  He shuts his eyes tightly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...which I loaded, believe it or not, and pressed it to my forehead. And I remember thinking, at the time, I'm gonna kill myself.  Then I thought...what if I'm wrong? What if there is a God?  I mean, after all, nobody really knows that. The camera moves past the desperate Mickey to a mirror on the wall behind him.  Its reflection shows his spiral staircase and some standing lamps.  A clock faintly ticks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But then I thought, no.  You know, maybe is not good enough.  I want certainty or nothing.  And I remember very clearly the clock was ticking, and I was sitting there frozen, with the gun to my head, debating whether to shoot. The gun goes off with a loud bang.  The mirror shatters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All of a sudden, the gun went off. Mickey, holding the rifle, is seen running over to the shattered mirror.  The sounds of his excited neighbors, their shouting, a knocking door, are heard as he continues his tale.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had been so tense, my finger had squeezed the trigger inadvertently...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (offscreen, overlapping) What's happening?  Wh-wh-what's going on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (continuing) ...but I was perspiring so much, the gun had slid off my forehead and missed me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (offscreen, overlapping) I don't know.  I heard a gun.  Is everything all right? Mickey, still brandishing the rifle, runs into his sunlit living room.  He looks around frantically, his shirt loose. Finally, he throws the rifle down between the sofa and the coffee table.  The gun goes off a second time.  Mickey, standing nearby, jumps, his hands flying to his head.  The doorbell rings; the neighbors begin pounding at the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And suddenly, neighbors were, were, pounding on the door, and-and I don't know, the whole scene was just pandemonium.  And, uh, you know, and I-I-I-I-I ran to the door. Mickey runs offscreen briefly to answer the door.
direction.name: direction
